result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew E. Wilcox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:00 a.m. Defendant Matthew E. Wilcox in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement.  Plea questionaire filed.  State moves to dismiss but read-in Count 2. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Victim rights complied with. Schiek/Drewa/Danielle Wilcox/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence
Imposed and stayed - to be used by agent in event of violation- Jail - 30 days with huber for all purposes 

WHS/POP - 2 years (as provided in 973.09(2)(c))
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Comply with any requirements of Oneida County Social Services
No intoxicants; no taverns
Jail credit - 1 day
Any other conditions/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO

Appeal Rights given
Adj. 11:40 a.m.

4:03 p.m. Defendant Matthew E. Wilcox in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Drewa states preliminary discussions for resolution  have been held; requests adjournment - confident resolution w/o trial. Bail continued.  Adj. 4:04 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

02:57 pm - Defendant Matthew E. Wilcox in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
No intoxicants. No taverns, May not possess firearms

Defendant Matthew E. Wilcox in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
